decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title(s) - Revision B Proposed Plans (Loft and Roof) - 1234-PL101-02 Rev. B, Proposed Garden House - 1234-PL101-03 Rev. B, Proposed Elevation (Sheet 1 of 3) - 1234-PL201-01 Rev B

Proposed Elevations (Sheet 2 of 3) - 1234-PL201-02 Rev B, Proposed Elevations (Sheet 3 of 3) - 1234-PL201-03 Rev B, Roof Dormer and Edge Detail - 1234-PL301-01 Rev B, Window Detail - 1234-PL301-02 Rev A and Garden house Door Detail - 1234-PL301-03 Issue X
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.
| Notwithstanding the details shown on the revised plans, all external materials to be used in the development shall be as per Condition 2: Approved plans.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Policy DAA of Ealing's local Plan (Reg.18), Brentham Garden Estate Management Plan, Policies D1,D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) - sections 12 and 16.

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any subsequent amendment, revision or new Order) no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the extension permitted.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Polices D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| The detached outbuilding hereby approved shall only be used for purposes incidental and ancillary to the enjoyment of the dwelling on this site and shall not be used for separate habitable accommodation including the installation of any bathroom facilities, kitchen facilities or cooking equipment.

Reason: To ensure that the development does not detract from the amenity of the adjoining properties, and to enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control over the use of the building in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D4 of the London Plan (2021), the  Ealing Local Plan 2022 (Reg 18), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) - sections 12 and 16 | The proposed roof light to the main roof shall be a Conservation style roof light, lie flush with the roof, contain only obscure glass, and only have top openings at a minimum of 1.7m from floor level, and remain in perpetuity.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, and to safeguard the character and appearance of the conservation area and to protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties in accordance with National Planning Policy Framework 2021 - section 16, policies D1 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policy DAA of Ealing's Local Plan (Reg.18) and policies 1.1, 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012).
description: Rear dormer roof extension, installation of Conservation rooflight to main rear roofslope and single storey detached rear garden outbuilding for use as an office with associated paving
